dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE LAMOTTA, wearing a tux, is shadow-boxing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are unsure of where he is -- he moves in and out of th shadows. At 42, he's overweight and out of shape, but the balls of his feet still pop up and down like they were on canvas and his tiny fists still jerk forward with short bursts of light. He is rehearsing a nightclub monologue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. It's a thrill to be standing here talking to you wonderful people. In fact, it's a thrill to be standing! I haven't seen so many people since my last fight at Madison Square Garden. After that fight, a reporter asked me, 'Jake, where do you go from here?' I said, 'To a hospital!' I fought one hundred and six professional fights and still none of them bums figured out how to fight me -- they kept hitting me in the head! And that's why I'm here tonight... (starts to sing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'When the fighter's not engaged in his employment, his employment, although he was Champ and quite the rage, he must go somewhere else to seek employment, seek employment. But a fighter's life is not a bowl of cherries, still I'd rather have an egg than a fist upon my face... That's Entertainment!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bam! JIMMY REEVES, a fast, black middleweight, jabs LAMOT 19 years old, in the face. JAKE staggers forward. No matt how hard LAMOTTA is hit, no matter how often, he always staggers forward -- like a bull. The bell sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battered, JAKE slumps on the stool in his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's September, 1941. Europe and Asia are already at war. Young SOLDIERS, freshly recruited, dot the hostile audien each screaming at the FIGHTERS in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, words are exchanged, a GIRL screams, and a SOLD and a CIVILIAN stand and start swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND IN THE RING: JAKE LAMOTTA takes a swig of water and s blood into the bucket his younger brother, JOEY, holds fo him. TONY, his trainer, works the cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to come to Cleveland to get beat by a "moulan yan," Jake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got you, Jake! You're outpointed! You're coming up for the tenth. You gotta knock him out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell sounds for the tenth. JAKE pulls himself up and charges at REEVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REEVES slides away, jabbing, punching, piling up points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In JAKE's corner, JOEY stands and yells at JAKE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grand apiece! We got a grand apiece on this, Jake! A fucking grand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE suddenly corners REEVES and unleashes a desperate, w alley-fighting attack. One ferocious punch after another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPECTATORS go wild; everyone's up for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REEVES staggers, then falls to the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REFEREE counts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GAMBLERS call out new odds; ten to one for REEVES, th underdog. JOEY, excited, sees that time is running out an steps in front of the bell. He swings his arms, pretendin not to realize he literally holds back the TIMER's arm fo few seconds. This gives JAKE more time for a knockout -- not enough. JOEY is pushed back and the bell rings at the count of nine, ending the match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boos and cheers. The BETTORS scramble back to the BOOKIE get their money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE dances around the ring, kissing his gloves and thrus them toward the CROWD. JOEY rushes out and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ANNOUNCER steps into the ring with the mike:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, the winner, under the rules of the Cleveland Boxing Commission, after ten rounds, by a decision -- Jimmy Reeves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ANNOUNCER holds up REEVES' arm as his corner tries to lift him off the canvas -- still out cold. TWO ATTENDANTS bring in a stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE is stunned. He still prances around, now trying to figure out what happened. He raises his arms in victory, the FANS go crazy, cheering, ripping chairs out, fighting with the COPS, throwing bottles and junk into the ring. PEOPLE go into the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get out of the ring. You won the fight -- let him go out first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REEVES being placed on the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ringside OFFICIAL signals the ORGANIST and she starts t play the "Star Spangled Banner." REEVES is carried out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only then do JOEY and TONY escort JAKE out of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rough neighborhood, inhabited primarily by welfare cases and street kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the street, two young PUNKS, 13 or 14 years old, excha words and start to fight. Their FRIENDS cheer them on. SA and JOEY turn the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvy, would I steer you wrong? Let's say that's the truck; it's full of cigarettes, right? Now, two o'clock this morning we move the truck from here to there, (he points; the CAMERA PANS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: take the cigarettes out, sell 'em, make some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey but Joey, you're thinking nickels and dimes. The money's with your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from my life, Salvy? He's my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't doin' the right thing. He's makin' beans compared to what he should be makin'. Can't you make him understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COP goes over and starts to break up the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, leave the kids alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost. (joking, he knows the Cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kids, "A cop is a rat." Remember that, "A rat."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KIDS yell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jimmy, here's a dollar for your trouble. There's some bums around the corner -- they need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the dollar, Joey. Get yourself a new suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my new suit. (grabs his crotch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't get wise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding, take it easy. (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckin' sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY and JOEY continue to walk a little faster, giggling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, bandaged from the REEVES fight the night before, si at the kitchen table (he's had a few glasses of wine) whi his wife, IRMA, 19, cooks at the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE gets up and pokes at the frying steak with a fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks done. I'll take it the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your steak. You can't wait for it to be done. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams the steak onto his plate, and reaches back to t stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your carrots. You're in such a hurry. You can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't wait. You know when I wait? When it's important to wait. It's not important to wait for no steak. It's important to wait for Reeves to leave the ring. It ain't important to wait for no steak! I won that fight. So, I stayed in the ring, and that way I made sure everybody knew it. I shoulda knocked him out earlier, sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to eat the steak. He takes a drink of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I'll wait. But let me tell you, if this steak was the middleweight championship, I'd show you how I'd wait. I'd eat it raw. I'd drink the blood. I'd eat it before it came out of the cow -- that's how I'd wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY and JOEY approach the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't convince him. He's got such a thick head, I'd like to crack it open myself. Believe me, my own brother. It's very hard. You don't have to convince me -- I know we should be with Tommy. You talk to him. He don't listen to nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm just tellin' you how Tommy feels. Jake is makin' it hard on himself. Tommy wants him with us. It's as simple as that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk some sense into him, will ya? You're still his brother. If he ain't gonna listen to you, he ain't gonna listen to nobody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll try. See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, at the gym. Don't forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY leaves. JOEY goes into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY is knocking at the door. IRMA opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goes to Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You're drinking. You're eating like an animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY sits next to JAKE at the kitchen table. JAKE has a d in his hand, and tears on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE goes into the living room. IRMA looks at JOEY. JOEY follows JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY walks up to JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, c'mon, what's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (privately, to Joey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't ever gonna fight Joe Louis, that's what's the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? He's a heavyweight. You're a middleweight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE holds out his scarred hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these hands. These fuckin' hands. I was born with a girl's hands. And even if I put on enough weight to be a heavyweight, I'd be too slow to fight. No matter how big I get, I'll never be big enough to fight Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE pauses. IRMA watches from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm sayin'. You shouldn't even think like that. It's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you one thing. Ok, I'll never be big enough to fight Louis, but I know Joey, I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, I said hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jack. You had a few drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. I ain't drunk. Take your best shot. On the jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, I got no gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs a nearby towel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY wraps it around his fist. IRMA watches. JOEY hits JA with his right. JAKE holds fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Hit me. C'mon, don't worry about it. I want you to hit me with everything you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY hauls off and lands him a real belt. JAKE rolls with and stands firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again. Harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY hits him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harder. Go 'head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY hits him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harder. (grabs the towel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the towel off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY hits him again. JAKE holds fast. JAKE starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that for? I know you can take punches. I can hit you from now to doomsday. What the fuck does that prove?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that, I don't feel it. I can take it. I know I can take anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gleason's, a small gym and fight club, stands on 149th St and 3rd Avenue above a small sandwich shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each day BOBBY GLEASON posts a small sign alongside the d listing the fighters who will be working out. JAKE's name posted at the top; the other names are unmemorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gleason's has a single sparring ring and ten training bag About a dozen managers train their fighters out at Gleaso For 50 cents, spectators sit in the gallery and watch the workouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE is sparring with JOEY in the ring. They've been work out for a while now. The bell rings ending the third roun JAKE prances about the ring waiting for the bell to sound again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, SALVY, along with two other young "BUTTON MEN (actually, they are very young -- about JOEY's age) e the gym. They are well-dressed (over-coat, ties, suits, flashy rings, etc.). They say hello to some PEOPLE by the door. JAKE looks over and notices them. SALVY looks over the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Joey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, how you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE nods to SALVY very cold. SALVY notices and can feel he's not exactly wanted there by JAKE. JOEY notices the s and becomes a bit nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY sits down near the ring but not as close as he'd li to. His two friends, FRANKIE and GUIDO, sit nearby also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE goes to JOEY's corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know they were coming up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me when I talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. They just wanted to talk to you. So I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever bring those kids up here again! I'm working out, I'm killin' myself in here, and they walk around like they fuckin' own the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY and the OTHERS see JOEY being chewed out by JAKE. T begin to feel unwelcome at the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell sounds. JAKE is more aggressive now as he corner JOEY. JAKE swings away with body punches. JOEY can't bloc them. SALVY and the OTHERS watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell sounds again. With that, SALVY and the OTHERS st to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Joey, we better go. See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY, dazed, turns to wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go 'head. Wave goodbye. They're your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE watches them leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that hard-on, Salvy. Who's he think he is? I'm gonna let that fuckin' hard-on come up here and act like a big shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you getting so hot about -- Tommy Como told him to come down here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't care about Tommy Como. I don't care about Jesus Christ on the fuckin' cross. I gotta give them a percentage of what I make! I'm in here breaking my ass, not them. Don't ever bring them up here again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell them to come. Tommy Como...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell sounds again. JAKE hits JOEY a few more solid bo punches. JOEY gets angry and fights back with a flurry of punches which have no effect on JAKE. JAKE laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, fight back. I got laid three times before I came up here this morning and I can still break your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY fights back, but it's no use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cocksucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE laughs. The two continue to swing it out, as SALVY watches unseen from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shorehaven Pool, spic-and-span in the summer sun is t closest thing to a country club in the Bronx. An eight fo fence stands between the pool and the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, wearing slacks and a sportshirt, hangs out with the "BOYS" near the bar area. Older, "MADE" MEN play cards. A young FAN walks by and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the opposite end of the pool where the GIRLS gossip, a sunbathe, JOEY swaps small talk with VICKIE, a school gir about 15. VICKIE is a knockout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY, FRANKIE and JUNIOR are with VICKIE and her FRIENDS They joke with JOEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE watches SALVY and VICKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE'S P.O.V.: JOEY is talking (PAN) to VICKIE. VICKIE giggles. JOEY stands and walks over to JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to Vickie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadda you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadda ya mean, whadda I care? Who is she? What's a matter? You afraid I'm gonna take her on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not afraid. Why? You wanna meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I'll go right over there and bring her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go 'head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you wanna meet her? Don't make me go over there, you change your mind and you make me look bad, cause she's really a knockout. She's 15, this kid -- a great piece of ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? You know her that good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I see her around the pool. I know her. I know her like that -- not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing to his bandage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, not now... I wanna wait. I don't feel right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE watches VICKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you, she'll be there, I know she'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I wanna catch her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you gonna catch anybody alone at a dance?... I don't know if she'll be there alone... She'll probably be there with her girlfriends or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ever go with them? Like Salvy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, she don't go with nobody. She's only 15 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with it? She don't look 15 to me. I heard somethin' with Salvy. She was with him once or somethin', I think. It was like some blonde. That's the one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. You know she talks to everybody, and not just him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, some piece of ass, I'm tellin' you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wasn't with her, were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wasn't with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, like bang her or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no, no. I didn't bang her. I know her from around here, that's all. You want to meet her or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, not now -- all those hard-ons around. I'll wait. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene ends on VICKIE as JAKE watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you, she'll be there, I know she'll be there. Dressed up and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like all those other clowns around. That's all I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, hurry up. We're never gonna get outa here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY sips a drink as JAKE knots his tie. IRMA enters from bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going at this hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you, a cop? I'm goin' out -- business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' worm, if you're going out, I'm going out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your fuckin' business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY lifts his eyes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, go out. Do what you're gonna do. What do I care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY opens the door to leave. JAKE follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- run out. I ain't gonna be here when you get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE and JOEY hurry down the stairs. IRMA shouts after th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunch of guys. You all hang out together. Yeah, you're all going out on business. You're all gonna suck each other off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a mouth on her -- you shoulda hit her -- no good fuckin' Jewish cunt -- breakin' our balls. You shoulda hit her with a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, watch your mouth. Don't talk like that. She's still my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but Jake... how much abuse can you take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times do I have to hit her? I hit her enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit to street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY and JAKE come out of the building and start walking the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRMA opens the window on the second floor right above the and shouts out to them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead -- that's all you're good for -- to go out and leave me here like a dog. You and your brother! You don't even look like brothers. You look like faggots! That's what you look like -- faggots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE and JOEY walk faster down the block, pretending that IRMA must be shouting at someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a bottle at them. It smashes in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neighborhood dance is in progress. A small BAND is play while mainly OLDER COUPLES dance. There are TWO PRIESTS present. The younger people are divided into two groups - the BOYS, who are dressed in suits and ties, and spend mo of their time at the bar area -- and the GIRLS, who are i evening dresses, and spend most of their time dancing together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the more popular GIRLS are surrounded by "WISE-GU There are tables near the dance floor with "set ups" (bot of Scotch, rye, and a bucket of ice) on them. These table are the "bases of operation" for different neighborhood groups, as if they were street corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "good looking?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's popular. A lotta people like Janiro. You beat him and it only figures they'll wanna see you get a title shot. But, what do I know? I should keep my mouth shut, I should...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who asked you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Jake, I was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who asked you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who asked you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKIE, amazed, gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKIE rounds up the kids and takes them into the kitchen (MOVING SHOT).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE VICKIE in the kitchen angrily throwing things arou We clearly see the tension as she cleans up, muttering to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Joey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, manager. Everybody had their say around here. Now this is what I'm gonna say. I'm gonna get down to 155, and I'm gonna destroy this kid -- get my title shot. And don't ever bet 15 thousand without my sayso again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE comes into the kitchen. He tries to make up with VIC She plays hard-to-get. They begin to tease each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COMEDIAN is in the middle of his act. JAKE, VICKIE, JOE and JANET sit at a nearby table. JANET, an attractive blo is are of JOEY's girlfriends; the moment you set eyes on you know this is not his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lounge is very crowded. The COMEDIAN interrupts his routine to point out that JAKE LAMOTTA is in the audience and even tries a little harmless joking at JAKE's expense

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I'd like to point out a special guest we have with us tonight -- The Raging Bull, The Bronx Bull, Mr. Jake LaMotta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is applause. JAKE smiles, and gives a hesitant wave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand up, Jake, c'mon. Oh, you are standing. Sorry. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kiddin', Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE waves a fist at the COMEDIAN, good-naturedly playing along with the joke -- even though he hates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this abuse I gotta take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY, VICKIE, and JANET are amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny? (lifting his glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers! Post-time. Joey, Vickie, and... (to Janet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name again, darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE Smiles. They all drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY, a little older, but still young-looking, and dress even better than when we last saw him (flashy rings, etc. comes over to their table. He walks around like he owns t fucking place. JAKE hates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Joey. Jake, how you doin'? Vickie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They respond. JAKE is cold towards SALVY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY goes on his way to COMO's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As SALVY walks away, JAKE turns to VICKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you lookin' at? You lookin' at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. I'm looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me "No." I saw you lookin' at him. Why, you like him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not interested in him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words, you're not interested in him but you'd be interested in somebody else, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, c'mon now. Don't start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Joey, referring to Salvy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, all of a sudden everybody's a fuckin' Romeo around here. Did you see the way she was lookin' at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, she would never...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you just see her lookin' at him? She told me no, but I don't believe her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jake. You know she's crazy about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE gives him a suspicious look. JOEY feels uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just love to catch her. Oooooh, I'd just love to catch her once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinks arrive at their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are from Tommy Como.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE looks up but can't see where COMO is. JOEY gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a minute. Be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be long. I'm afraid with all these tough guys here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY goes to COMO's table in the rear of the lounge. JAKE slides over and watches. JOEY shakes hands with COMO. SAL is there at COMO's table. JOEY comes right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, come over for a few minutes. Tommy wants to say hello to you. C'mon, just come and say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE doesn't like the idea, but goes along with it anyway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER ANGLE: COMO's table. JAKE comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Tommy. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, sit down for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE sits. SALVY smiles and nods to JAKE. JAKE barely nod back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his arm around Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' kid! You're the best fuckin' fighter around. Loved what you did to Satterfield. Them "moulan yans" -- forget about it. They're all afraid to fight you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Tommy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feelin'? Ok? You feelin' good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never felt better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Janiro's gotta watch out, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Salvy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Janiro's a good fiahter, pretty good-lookin' kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet on him three times. Always come through for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE just stares, holding his anger in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the weight? Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the weight's Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another pause. TOMMY smiles and moves closer to JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, lemme ask you something. Let's say I was a good friend of yours. And I was telling you I was gonna bet a lot of money on you in this Janiro fight. What would you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd tell you to bet a bundle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY sips his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKIE is in bed trying to sleep. JAKE comes out of the bathroom half-dressed, and sits on the edge of the bed (preoccupied). Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickie?... Vickie, you asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, you think of anybody else when I'm making love to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody. I love you, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd you say that thing about Tony Janiro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he's got a pretty face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never noticed his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're not thinking of him right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who said he was good looking. You think he's good looking 'cause I know you think he's good-looking. I'll smash his face inside out. I'll make him into dog meat. Nobody's gonna think he's good-looking when I get through with him. So you just go ahead and think about who you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKIE freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY JANIRO, wearing boxer trunks, steps off the scale. Commissioner COL. EDDIE EAGAN, a white-haired, heavyset m in his mid-forties, calls out the weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement of the New York Boxing Commission on Worth Street is a sparse room, crowded with REPORTERS, TRAINERS MANAGERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Janiro, 151 lbs. and one half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE steps on the scale. He looks weak and woozy. After t customary adjustments, EAGAN calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake LaMotta, 155 lbs. and one fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a commotion in JAKE's camp. JANIRO smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, JOEY, and TONY confer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE gets off the scale and enters the men's room. An OFFICIAL follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE forces himself to urinate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE comes out of the bathroom, and gets back on the scal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. This is official.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAMOTTA stares at JANIRO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaMotta, 155 lbs. on the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE throws JANIRO a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the last round and JAKE is pouring it on a beaten an virtually helpless JANIRO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD chants:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaMotta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALF THE AUDIENCE is already on its feet. The kill is imminent -- and they love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE lands one blow after another. He is relentless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several rows back, TOMMY COMO, SALVY and SEVERAL OTHER "M GUYS sit with sober looks on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE moves in fast, and with a powerful barrage, smashes JANIRO's nose -- plastering it against his left cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final bell rings. JANIRO, his legs all rubber, stagge back to his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE prances about, kissing his fists and throwing them t the CROWD. JOEY rushes out, throws JAKE's leopard skin ro over him and embraces him. TONY follows. JAKE looks right COMO and SALVY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANNOUNCER steps into the center of the ring:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winner, by unanimous decision, in ten rounds, Jake LaMotta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, weak from losing the weight and winning the fight, still manages to prance around the ring victoriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKIE, now near the ring, throws kisses to JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts to Vickie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my night! Listen to them! I'm gonna be champ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends down and gives her a kiss through the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making everything up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY is at the bar with a DETROIT PROMOTER and JACKIE CUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we gonna get Jake back in Detroit? Jesus, he really did a job on Janiro. Who you after next, Joey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evasive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. We're working on it. He's training at the camp now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what I seen, they gotta give him a shot at the title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get our shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DETROIT PROMOTER introduces JOEY to JACKIE CURTIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Joey, this is Jackie Curtie. He handles a lot of business in South Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your brother. Made a lot of money on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betcha more than he has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made a little cabbage on the Tommy Bell fight too. Whatever happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. He's got a job downtown. Runs an elevator in some building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went down to see him the other day. I says, "Tommy, take me up to the fifth floor." And you know, he took me right up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Tommy always was a stand-up guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY and PATSY arrive with VERA, SANDY (two neighborhood girls), and VICKIE. They go to a nearby table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar area: JOEY sees this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, let me get you another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute. Excuse me. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table area: JOEY arrives at SALVY's table. VICKIE is nervous. There is a cold exchange of'"hellos."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vickie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere, let me talk to you for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward silence as he grabs VICKIE by the arm takes her over to the hat-check area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin' with Salvy? You shouldn't be here with him. Jake's away killin' himself. Suppose he found out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell am I doing wrong? Just because Jake is training, I can't go out? What am I, a goddamn prisoner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing anythina wrong. I'm just trying to have a good time. Do I have to be cooped up in the house all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't look right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go ahead, tell Jake. He's gonna kill me anyway. It's a matter of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna tell him nothing; but if he finds out, he will kill you. What's the matter with you? Aren't you happy? You got everything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't sleep with him. I do. I don't get to breathe without tellin' him. He keeps me in a cage. If he thinks I'm lookin' at somebody the wrong way, I get used as a punching bag. He don't trust nobody. If he saw the two of us talking together right now, you'd be in trouble too -- believe me. Look at me, Joey. I'm 19 years old. I wanna enjoy my life. I love Jake, but you don't know. He gets crazy sometimes. I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to understand, Vickie. Jake's got a lotta aggravation. He's been a top contender too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, take his part. You're his brother. He's never gonna be champ. Too many people are against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're drinking with them right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm gonna finish my drink. And, I'm gonna have a good time, because I ain't doing nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to go back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong to be here. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKIE pulls away from JOEY, and goes back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table area: JOEY arrives at the table. He grabs VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, relax. You're taking this the wrong way. Why don't you sit down and have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I'm talking to my sister in-law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, I'm blind? My brother's breaking his ass in a ring, and you're here with his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Joey, I'm here with Patsy and Vera and Sandy. And Vickie just happened to come along. We're just trying to have a good time. What do you want from me? So, why don't you just take it easy before this gets out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the conversation gets louder, PEOPLE begin to notice. PAUL, the owner (a tough-looking, well-dressed guy), and BOUNCERS also become aware of the argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outa here. What did you do, take your gangster pills today? I'll tear your fuckin' head off your shoulders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY goes for SALVY. PEOPLE react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRLS begin to scream. VICKIE exits. JOEY notices her leave, and calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL comes over and stops the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you forgettin' something? Ain't there never supposed to be no trouble in this joint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY and JOEY give each other looks. JOEY goes out after VICKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY looks up the street for VICKIE. She is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY and PATSY come out of the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Joey, whadda ya lookin' to die young?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he turns and lashes into Salvy and Patsy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll suck your eyes out! I'll fuckin' take the two of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few moments, PAUL and the BOUNCERS from the Copa out. The BOUNCERS pull PATSY away. They try to separate S and JOEY, but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY savagely beats SALVY on the Copa steps and in the st against the parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' low-life, cocksucker, etc. ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY tries to fight back, but JOEY is too tough for him. SALVY hits the pavement. JOEY kicks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL, PATSY, and the BOUNCERS finally pull JOEY away. PAT tries to go after JOEY again, but PAUL stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuckin' put your hands on me! You're gonna near about this, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patsy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outa here. Don't come in my place and start fuckin' trouble -- I don't care who you are! (to Joey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outa here. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY looks back at him, and then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is furnished with a few round tables and some chairs; it is somewhat reminiscent of an old-fashioned ca store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY COMO, SALVY, PATSY and JOEY are present. SALVY's fa is bruised from the beating JOEY gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rightg I don't have to hear any more. I think I understand what happened. I understand it was your brother's wife and there was probably a misunderstanding. I'm not sayin' Salvy shouldn't have acted the way he did. But, Joey, you don't raise your hands. You don't do that kind of thing. This time we forget about it but no more after this. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I understand, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you guys, shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY, JOEY, and PATSY shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go 'head. Be friends. That's it. (to Salvy and Patsy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, lemme be alone with him for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALVY and PATSY exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aside from everything else, your family all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're good. They're good, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it with you? Can't you talk? You got like a funny attitude. I can't figure you out, Joey. What's with you and the quick answers? You wanna get outa here fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Tommy, c'mon, it ain't that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Joey, I wanna tell you something. Your brother ain't gonna get nowhere without us -- nowhere. And I'm tellin' you between the two of us, it's gettin' to the point where it's gettin' to be a real embarrassment to me, a real embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can he embarrass you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an embarrassment because Frankie and the other guys are expectin' me to do something about it, and I'm lookin' very bad. I can't deliver a kid from my own neighborhood. Why's he make it so hard on himself? He comes to me, I can make it easier for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, Jake respects you. He won't even say hello to anybody else -- you know that. But you know when Jake gets set on somethin', Jesus Christ Almighty could get off the fuckin' cross and he ain't gonna talk him out of it. I'm his kid brother. I got no say with Jake on this. He thinks he can buck everybody and make it on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it on his own? Does he know the kind of money involved? I mean the real money. He thinks he's gonna become champ on his own? We're gonna sit by and see some nut come in there and hold one of the most important titles in the world? A nut who don't listen to nobody or respect nobody? Is he really crazy? Listen, Joey, you understand, you tell him. I don't care how great he is or how colorful. He could beat all the Sugar Ray Robinsons and all the Janiros he wants to. He ain't gonna get a shot at the title without us. I'm not askin' you to do another thing except get that message into that thick head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day. JOEY, fully clothed, opens the gate and look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE is sitting alone near the deep end. JOEY walks over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember the first time I met Vickie... I know there's somethin' up. I know she's doin' somethin', but I can't catch her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's afraid you're gonna hit her so she can't talk to you the way she wants to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try talkin' to her. She's your wife -- ask her what's the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm away, did you ever notice anythin' funny with her? Tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, if there was anything funny, I would tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to keep an eye on her when I'm not here. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I'll keep an eye on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Tommy say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got good news, and I got bad news. The good news is you got your shot at the title. The bad news is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting, resigned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As BILLY FOX steps off the scales, EDDIE EAGAN calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy Fox, 173 3/4 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY removes JAKE's leopard-skin robe as he steps on the scale. The REPORTERS crowd around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake LaMotta, 167 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE'S HANDLERS urge him with words of encouragement as t walk toward his dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAGAN walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to talk to Jake a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose you heard what everybody's been saying, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What who's been sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a big favorite in this fight. Then two days ago the odds start jumping all over the place until you're a 12-5 underdog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't follow no gamblin' Commissioner. I'm just a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the fight's off the books altogether. Meyer Lansky couldn't get a bet down on this fight. Some people are saying you're going into the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to believe you, LaMotta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill him. That fuckin' jig's gonna wish he never came outa the jungle. You got any money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any money you want to bet on Billy Fox, you can put it right here... (extends his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'cause Jake LaMotta don't go down for nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAGAN taps JAKE on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I wanted to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE glares at EAGAN as the COMMISSIONER walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Garden is packed. The EX-CHAMPS, the PRESS, the OFFICIALS, the MOB GUYS, the FANS -- they're all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIGHTERS are announced. BILLY FOX and JAKE touch glov and return to their corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOX is taller and has a longer reach than JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell sounds and the FIGHTERS come out. FOX goes to th head; JAKE goes to the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOX lands a solid blow to JAKE's jaw, but LAMOTTA is unfa FOX is surprised. In the past, his opponents have gone do when he connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the audience, COMO, SALVY, and some other BOYS watch w interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE moves in with a rapid series of trademark body blows All of a sudden, FOX is wobbly. JAKE goes for the head, t cuts his punch short. FOX is about to go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE throws his arms around FOX to make sure he doesn't f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand up! What the fuck are you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REFEREE breaks them apart and FOX remounts his attack JAKE bicycles into a corner and lets FOX work him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOX connects: once, twice, three times. JAKE barely defen himself -- but he doesn't go down either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD starts to smell a fix. There are calls from the AUDIENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your swimming trunks on, Jake? I hope they're paying you enough. Fake, fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE's corner. JAKE is acting stunned. TONY, not aware of what's going on, is slapping JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you? What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign reads "Round Four." JAKE is in the center of the ring taking a relentless pasting from FOX. JAKE's arms ha at waist level... FOX lands one blow after another. The s of a fix permeates the arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE is furious that FOX can't deck him. He curses throug his mouthpiece (as he absorbs blow after blow):

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me! Hit me! What's the matter with you, you motherfucker? Hit me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boos and catcalls echo through the Garden. This is not ev fight. The REFEREE, realizing this, steps in between FOX LAMOTTA, waves his arms and signals that FOX is the winne a technical knockout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does, JAKE spits his mouthpiece in disgust at FOX a struts back to his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, JOEY, and TONY are already on their way out of the arena as the REFEREE declares FOX the winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMO and the OTHERS, satisfied, get up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a REPORTER and a PHOTOGRAPHER come through the door, W SEE and hear a commotion in the hall behind them. They ru in, look, and stop by the door. There is silence -- excep for JAKE'S uncontrollable sobbing. The atmosphere is like that of funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE is seated behind the rubbing table. He is still in h leopard-skin robe. His head hangs low as he sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHOTOGRAPHER snaps a picture. The HANDLER motions to to stop, and then goes and sits near the door. The REPORT still stands near the doorway, seeming quite stunned by t scene he is witnessing, but nevertheless continuing to scribble away on his pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY, standing near JAKE, has his back to everyone; his shoulders are shaking, his lips are tightly drawn. He cri soundlessly. TONY is pacing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fight anymore! (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a free country, don't fight anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between sobs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did they have to stop it? Why did they have to stop it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REPORTER leans over to the HANDLER and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must've been really hurt in the 2nd. He didn't answer me when I tried to tell him something in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, still buried in his robe, becomes aware of the hum voices and shouts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get everyone out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REPORTER and the PHOTOGRAPHER leave. JAKE continues t sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: CLOSE UP of a Daily News Headline from November 2 1947: "Board Suspends LaMotta."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, dejected, sits on the couch. In front of him, on th coffee table are scattered several newspapers -- includin the one with the headline we have just seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY paces in front of JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It woulda been so easy, Jack. So easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY goes into a boxing stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick out your hands, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'wan, do it. (jabs at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protect yourself, rummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, out of reflex, sticks out his hands. As he does, JO feigns a hit and falls onto the floor -- "out cold." JAKE looks down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY pops to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? That's all there was to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck they want? I took the dive. They want me to fall down too? I don't fall down for nobody. I never went down in my life. Joey, what do I gotta do? Crawl on my hands and knees? I made an asshole of myself in the fuckin' Garden! All the newspaper writers make fun of me. I'm the bum of the year. All I want is a shot. Just a fuckin' shot. What do I gotta do? I'll do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except fall down like a normal person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, except fall down. That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you don't wanna fall down, so now you gotta take a rest. So, you enjoy the suspension. 'Cause there's nothin' you can do about it. Let the Commissioner and the D.A. jerk you around. So you wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Seven months! What am I gonna do for seven months? I'm gonna go crazy. How do I keep my strength? By that time I'll be too weak to win the title. And my weight? Forget about it -- I'm gonna blow up like a balloon. I ain't never gonna hold my weight down. Seven months! I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did what we had to do. Tommy don't forget. Sooner or later you'll get your shot -- if Tommy don't die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining outside the stately Book-Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner above the door proclaims. The Book-Cadillac Welcomes Marcel Cerdan Middleweight Champion of the World and the Challenger Jake LaMotta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is chaotic: FIGHT PEOPLE and SPORTSWRITERS mill anxiously about. Something's in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL CAPTAIN pages:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Williams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. WILLIAMS, THE DETROIT PROMOTER last seen in the Copacabana Lounge, answers the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAMS listens on the phone a moment, then hands it bac the BELL CAPTAIN and announces:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's official. The fight's been postponed twenty-four hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A groan goes up from the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE's suite is modestly decorated and consists of a livi room and two bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PINTO is there sewing up a pork chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, shadow-boxing in sportswear, paces back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY watches him. VICKIE sits quietly on the sofa, sippin some wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. "No comment." (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like that? Good, 'cause I got a lot more "No comments" where that one came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY cuts the line off, then leaves the receiver off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna order up some stuff. Have a steak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't eat a steak. If I eat a steak, I'm gonna have trouble making the weigh-in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So eat just a little. You gotta eat something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do for 24 hours? I can't even eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE goes into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY goes over to the DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows him the pork chop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long did it take you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good. Try to get it down. It's gotta be no more than 30 seconds to be on the safe side if we gotta stitch him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE is alone. There is a knock at the door. JOEY opens i and pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, somebody wants to say hello to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY opens the door wider. TOMMY COMO is at the door with JOEY. JAKE goes over to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey champ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, thanks for coming over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just take it easy, now. You'll do all right. Feelin' Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just come by to wish you luck. (shakes his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're all right. Thanks anyway, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, champ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMO turns to go. He says goodbye to everyone in the livi room. He goes over and kisses VICKIE. JAKE watches this f the bedroom doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he kisses Vickie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her. As beautiful as always. Take care of that guy, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to the door with him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of him. Thanks, Tommy. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vickie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the bedroom doorway. JAKE grabs her arm, pull her in, and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing her toward the bed area)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you don't say goodbye to him like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't kiss like that. Hello and goodbye, that's all you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm talking about. Don't ever make me look bad on the night of my big fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurting my arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE has her by the night table now. They are edging thei way to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. You just say hello and goodbye to him. You don't kiss him the way you did. That's out of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE pushes her against the wall. The lamp falls. There i loud crash. She tries to move away. He grabs her by the throat and pins her against the wall. She's gagging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jake... I didn't say anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever do that again. You don't (he pushes her against the wall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gagging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY looks in and then starts to come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear what I said? You don't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes her again. VICKIE tries to get away, but can't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing her again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY has his hand on JAKE's arm, trying to pry it away fr VICKIE's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, Jake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY and the DOCTOR watch from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKIE's eyes close. JAKE releases his grip. JOEY helps VICKIE. JAKE watches this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't gonna ruin this fight for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright floodlights illuminate the arena. The weather's cl and the stadium is filled with cheering fight FANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANNOUNCER steps into the center of the ring and begins introduce the many CELEBRITIES that have gathered for the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here is the young man who has inherited Marcel Cerdan's European championship - Laurent Dauthuille.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAUTHUILLE jumps into the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While WE HEAR him introduce the boxers and celebrities, W SEE a rapid MONTAGE: JAKE preparing for the title bout:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) JAKE and GROUP arrive in the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B) In his bathrobe, JAKE puts on his boxing shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C) We see a pan with raw steak in it. JOEY drains the blo (juice) into a glass and JAKE takes a long, slow swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D) REPRISE of IMAGES from PREVIOUS SCENE (SLOW MOTION) - ANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY COMO shakes JAKE's hand in the bathroom doorway. VI kisses COMO. Jake watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our very special guest tonight needs no introduction. The only man to defend the heavyweight crown a remarkable twenty-five times, the king of all heavyweights, the Brown Bomber, Joe Louis. Come into the ring, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Johnny. Let's bring the middleweight crown back to the old U.S.A. where it belongs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E) DR. PINTO injects a hypodermic needle filled with novocaine into each of JAKE's fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F) JOEY massages JAKE's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G) JAKE's hands are bandaged

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H) REPRISE of IMAGES from PREVIOUS SCENE (SLOW MOTION - N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE strangles VICKIE in the bedroom, then releases her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY looks after her, but the IMAGE makes them look as if they're making love. Jake watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in this corner, the middleweight champion of the world, from Casablanca, Morocco, the Casablanca Clouter, Marcel Cerdan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I) JAKE puts on his cup and trunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J) MARIO laces up JAKE's gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K) JAKE, ready to fight, a towel draped around his head, bounces on the balls of his feet. He starts walking down corridor from his dressing room, surrounded by MARIO, JOE DR. PINTO and his HANDLERS. He enters the stadium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, wearing his leopard-skin robe, is pushed through th CROWD by JOEY, MARIO and his HANDLERS. He's still shadow boxing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE steps into the ring to both cheers and boos (many st remember the Fox fight). JAKE raises his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the opposite corner, from New York, New York, the challenger, the Bronx Bull, Jake LaMotta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE shakes hands with the assembled CELEBRITIES and EX CHAMPIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only wish it was you, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Win the belt back for us, Jake. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE glances at VICKIE who is sitting in the third row. S is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening bell sounds. CERDAN and LAMOTTA touch gloves begin to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE is hot: there's no stopping him tonight. He fights l a man possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CERDAN clinches JAKE to avoid his brutal body blows. JAKE pushes him out of the clinch in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no more boos. JAKE has won over the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: END OF ROUND NINE. JAKE is working over a bloody CERDAN. Punches to the body, then to the head, then back to the b The bell sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE walks back to his corner and sits down. JOEY is ecstatic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him, Jackie! You got at! The fuckin' championship! He's yours! Finish him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE doesn't have the chance. The REFEREE, standing in CERDAN's corner, waves his hands signaling the end of the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REFEREE holds up JAKE's hands as THE ANNOUNCER takes mike:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new middleweight champion of the world by a knockout after nine rounds, the Bronx Bull, Jake LaMotta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY is all over him. TONY helps VICKIE through the MOB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his corner, CERDAN holds his head in his hands and say "My title, my title!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OFFICIALS clear a circle as they bring over the jewel studded championship belt. JOE LOUIS fastens the belt aro JAKE's waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE touches the oversized belt with his bloody gloves. T fall across JAKE's huge grin as he holds his hands high i the air. It is the most glorious night in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name "Jake LaMotta's Lounge" is emblazoned in neon ac a lounge/liquor store on Collins Avenue, Miami's main dra JAKE's bar is across from The Rooney Plaza, one of Miami' more prestigious hotels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifties cars are parked outside the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE LAMOTTA, 34 years old, wearing a tux, steps in front a large painted wall mural of the Cerdan fight as he ente his club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lounge is dominated by a large circular bar. Featured entertainers perform on a raised platform in the center o the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club is half filled with SPORTS, ENTERTAINMENT and MO TYPES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small BAND plays a routine fanfare as JAKE steps onto platform. He takes the mike with one hand and silences th BAND with the other. The applause dies out as he speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. It's a thrill to be standin' here talking to you wonderful people. In fact, it's a thrill to be standin'. I haven't seen so many people since my last fight at Madison Square Garden. After that fight a reporter asked me, "Jake, where do you go from here?" I said, "To a hospital."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About HALF THE PATRONS are listening; of them, HALF are laughing, SOME a little too loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fought one hundred and six professional fights and none of them bums figured out how to fight me -- they kept hitting me in the head! (calls to the bar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will somebody at the bar -- Linda?  - get me a drink. I figure if I'm gonna work to drunks I might as well be one of 'em! I like this place. It's a family type club... every night I see a lot of fathers sitting out there with their young daughters! That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LINDA hands him a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, honey. -- She's terrific. The kinda girl you wanta take home to meet your father. Especially if your old man's a degenerate! -- Here's a toast! "To your health! You only live once. But if you play it right, once is enough." I shouldn't be drinkin' like this 'cause I'm tryin' to lose weight. I'm on this terrific diet -- I'm allowed to eat anything I want. As long as I don't swallow it! Well, I never had much luck with my weight. In fact, -- I never had much luck with anything -- until about a few years ago, when this happened --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the blow-up behind him and waits for applaus of which there is some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... thanks, I'm glad to see you remember. For those of you that don't... that's me takin' the title from Cerdan. You know, the tough thing about winnin' the title... the next thing you gotta do is have a rematch... just to show it wasn't no fluke. So what happens? Marcel Cerdan, a really great champ, after I beat him... he gets himself killed in that airplane crash... a pretty rotten break for him. That's why I don't like to fly. People say to me, "Look, Jake, when your time is up, your time is up." And I say, "Yeah, but suppose I'm on the plane and the pilot's time is up?" As good as Cerdan was, I could've taken him again. But I never got the chance to prove it wasn't no fluke. He got killed but he got to be what they call a legend. I don't know what's worse -- bein' a fluke or bein' a legend. -- That's the kinda luck I got. That's why I quit the ring and moved down here from New York.
